exercises.name: Push-up
steps: Get down on all fours, placing your hands slightly wider than your shoulders.
Straighten your arms and legs.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor.
Pause, then push yourself back up.
exercises.description: A basic push-up works the chest, shoulders, and triceps muscles.

exercises.name: Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly turned out.
Bend your knees and push your hips back as if you're sitting in a chair.
Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Return to the starting position by pushing through your heels.
exercises.description: A fundamental exercise that targets the lower body, particularly the thighs and glutes.

exercises.name: Plank
steps: Get into a push-up position but rest on your forearms instead of your hands.
Ensure your body forms a straight line from your head to your feet.
Hold the position, engaging your core and keeping your body stable.
Keep your breathing steady.
exercises.description: An isometric exercise that strengthens the core and improves stability.

exercises.name: Lunges
steps: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart.
Take a big step forward with your right leg.
Lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee is nearly touching the ground.
Push back up to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.
exercises.description: A lower-body exercise that targets the legs and glutes, improving balance and coordination.

exercises.name: Bicep-Curls
steps: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
Keep your elbows close to your torso.
Curl the weights while contracting your biceps until the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
exercises.description: An isolation exercise that targets the biceps, helping to build arm strength.

exercises.name: Burpee
steps: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Lower into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
Kick your feet back into a push-up position and immediately drop your chest to the floor.
Return your feet to the squat position quickly.
Jump up into the air as high as you can, clapping your hands overhead.
exercises.description: A high-intensity full-body exercise that improves cardiovascular fitness, strength, and endurance.

exercises.name: Mountain-Climbers
steps: Start in a plank position with your arms straight and your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
Drive your right knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest.
Continue to alternate legs rapidly, as if running in place horizontally.
exercises.description: A dynamic core exercise that also engages the shoulders and legs, improving cardiovascular endurance.

exercises.name: Deadlift
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of you with an overhand grip.
Bend at your hips and knees, lowering the barbell to the ground.
Keep your back straight and your chest up as you lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees.
Stand tall at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the ground.
exercises.description: A fundamental strength exercise that targets the posterior chain, improving overall strength and power.

exercises.name: Shoulder-Press
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a pair of dumbbells at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
exercises.description: A key upper body exercise that strengthens the shoulders and triceps.

exercises.name: Russian-Twist
steps: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground, balancing on your sit bones.
Hold your hands together or a weight in front of you.
Twist your torso to the right, then to the left, tapping the ground or weight beside you each time.
exercises.description: An exercise that targets the core and oblique muscles, enhancing rotational strength and stability.

exercises.name: Bench-Press
steps: Lie on your back on a bench with a barbell in your hands.
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lower the barbell to your chest.
Press the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended.
exercises.description: A compound exercise that primarily targets the chest muscles along with the triceps and shoulders.

exercises.name: Pull-Up
steps: Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you.
Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended.
Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar.
Lower yourself back to the starting position.
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the back muscles, particularly the lats, as well as the biceps and shoulders.

exercises.name: Leg-Press
steps: Sit on the leg press machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
Keep your back flat against the seat and your knees at a 90-degree angle.
Push the platform away by extending your legs until they are fully extended.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise that targets the lower body muscles, particularly the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Lat-Pulldown
steps: Sit at a lat pulldown machine and grab the bar with a wide grip.
Lean back slightly with your chest up.
Pull the bar down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position.
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise that primarily targets the upper back muscles, particularly the lats, as well as the biceps.

exercises.name: Tricep-Dips
steps: Position yourself on parallel bars, holding your body up with your arms fully extended.
Keep your legs bent and feet off the ground.
Lower your body until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps, shoulders, and chest muscles.

exercises.name: Hamstring-Curl
steps: Lie face down on a hamstring curl machine with the roller pad positioned just above your heels.
Grip the handles for support.
Curl your legs up towards your buttocks, squeezing your hamstrings.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates and targets the hamstring muscles.

exercises.name: Calf-Raises
steps: Stand on a raised surface with the balls of your feet on the edge.
Keep your heels hanging off the edge.
Raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calves.
Lower your heels back down below the edge of the surface.
exercises.description: An exercise that targets the calf muscles, improving lower leg strength and stability.

exercises.name: Side-Plank
steps: Lie on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other.
Prop yourself up with your forearm directly under your shoulder.
Raise your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from head to feet.
Hold the position, keeping your core engaged.
exercises.description: An isometric exercise that targets the core and oblique muscles, enhancing stability and strength.

exercises.name: Bicycle-Crunches
steps: Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your legs lifted, knees bent at 90 degrees.
Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg.
Alternate sides in a pedaling motion, engaging your core.
exercises.description: A dynamic exercise that targets the core and oblique muscles, improving rotational strength and endurance.

exercises.name: Kettlebell-Swings
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell with both hands.
Hinge at your hips and swing the kettlebell back between your legs.
Thrust your hips forward to swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height.
Allow the kettlebell to swing back down between your legs and repeat.
exercises.description: A dynamic full-body exercise that improves cardiovascular fitness, strength, and power, particularly targeting the posterior chain.
